comments.commentBody:
The West did nothing to 'stoke these flames.' As for the repeated, and ridiculous, claim of $5 billion, that was spent over the past 20 plus years of Ukrainian independence and not just passed out in the past week.

You say that Putin is just reacting to the West. When did the West invade and then subsequently annex Crimea?

Putin DID start this. First by pushing Yanukovych to abandon the EU trade agreement he had spent two years negotiating. Then by telling him to use lethal force against the protesters in Kiev thinking they would just melt away. What melted away was Yanukovych's support in government and the country at large.

Then Putin organized protests in the east of Ukraine hoping the locals would get on board. They didn't. Then came the Russian separatist leaders and after that the mercenaries and advanced weapons.

To not lay the blame for recent events in Ukraine squarely at the feet of Putin is to merely spout the typical Kremlin sanctioned propaganda.

The West did not start this.  The West didn't initiate deadly force against the Maidan, the act that led to the overthrow of Yanukovich and the West didn't sponsor the separatist uprising in the East.  The five billion was money spent over a long period of time that went to many NGOs; impliedly tying it all to the Maidan is inaccurate.

US started the series of horrible events in Ukraine. They want to box Russia in and end  it's oil and gas shipments across Ukraine to Europe , substituting our own fracked natural gas. Control of energy supplies is the name of the game here as well as furthering America's imperial dreams.

"The Russian leaders prefer not to accept that the C.I.A. did not engineer the preference of many Ukrainians for what they see in the West."

Early on, the West too stoked these flames. The State Dept did everything in its power to do what it had done once before, repeat the color revolution. We boasted of that before it blew up in our faces, even boasted of spending $5 billion to do it. Then we started to deny it when it suddenly went wrong.

Now it is largely out of our control. Putin is now better positioned to dampen the violence than is anyone else. However, it is just not true to say HE started this. He is reacting to what the West did, and then what the West did ran out of its control.

This is the standard theme of the Right trying to disparage the Obama recovery. It's politically driven economic opinion, based on pure partisanship.

So, unemployment down from 10% to 6.3% and falling? Cant be true! Obama must be falsifying the figures. Naturally the same methods under GW Bush was all ok.

Inflation low and under control? Cant be true! Obama must be falsifying the figures. Naturally the same methods under GW Bush was all ok.

@Joshua: The Right did not invent calling into question inflation and unemployment figures.

Insofar as inflation being low and under control, yes I agree, now let's keep it that way.

"At worst, inflationistas resort to conspiracy theories: Inflation is already high, but the government is covering it up."

You can people of all political persuasions arguing the inflation figures released by the government do not show the true impact of rising costs on items like rent.
The same goes for the unemployment rate. Under reporting the unemployment rate is a charge used by all.
Don't be so self righteous and blind.

In a war zone, nerves are on edge and accidents occur. Such as the downing of Iran Air Flight 655 from Tehran to Dubai in 1988 by the United States Navy guided missile cruiser USS Vincennes .That incident happened inside Iranian airspace, and with a country with which the US was not at war but at high tension. All 290 on board died.

If those incidents occur in areas of tension not war, with highly professional and trained troops, they are bound to happen in war zones and where less professional forces operate.

To schedule flight into such area must stop , or all all those g passengers have died in vain .

The fact remains a fact. Bush had a huge deficit and praised it. Indeed, it was fiscal with lower taxes and big military and social government expenses He with Paul Ryan voting for it passed a $1.3 trillion prescription socialized medicine law (with 80% of Democrats voting against) that was totally unfunded.

Obama, as Krugman often quietly says. had a pathetically small stimulusu, reduced it too soon by cutting expenditures and raising taxes, and has cut the deficit to $500 billion.

Krugman should write about the real world rather than some irrelevant economists who will have no impact on Christie's policy.
That is just the best excuse they have for what they want to do anyway for other reasons, totally selfish reasons they dare not admit because the admission itself would lead to their defeat.

I'm afraid rightwing ideology is worse than just being wrong.  It is really just a reaction to what they deem the left or those other than themselves.  By demonizing first the far left, then the moderates and finally even much of the right, they have created a boogeyman that they see as always wrong and must be opposed for them to be right.  We think it is just President Obama they despise and oppose but next it will be Hillary or any leader or idea that is not from them.
Did Zimbabwe's inflation have the cause you mentioned?

Banks collected $30 billion in overdraft fees last year.
This kind of "business" consistently sucks more money from people who have very little to begin with.
Predatory financial behavior has nothing to do with a "real" economy.

Rewarding such behavior only speeds the demise of our culture.

When modern 'conservatism' abandoned reality and principle for ideology 35 years ago, it developed a constant need for false narratives to sustain itself since reality didn't provide as much potential for deception, sleight of hand and systematic swindling of the masses.

And now a giant bread-basket of new and improved false marketing narratives comprises the entire right-wing swiss-cheese theory point of view, wholly unconnected to reality, cause and effect and basic economics.

Hence the 'deficit' bogeyman, the 'inflation' bogeyman, the 'buy gold now' bogeyman, the 'Obamacare' bogeyman, the 'over-regulated Wall St.' bogeyman, and 'taxes are evil' bogeyman.

All of their 'scare and fear' false theories are used to gild the gilded while strip-mining the masses of labor and their last dollar vis-a-vis suppressed wages, suppressed government spending and front-running the commodity and securities markets before passing the worthless bubble to the masses.

The only thing that will lead to sustained inflation is broad-based demand originating from higher wages.

There are no signs of higher wages anywhere, only stagnating wages and more part-time employment guaranteeing flat, suppressed growth that perpetuates the derelict gini index disparity between wage slaves and large shareholders.

The only thing that ever trickled down from these economic shysters was poverty, despair and modern feudalism.

The Greedy Old Party remains a one-legged stool of malignant economic narcissism.

"President Eisenhower's signature achievement is the national highway system."

The Eisenhower Golden Age is not coming back. Don't know who longs for a return to those times more, liberals or conservatives.
what kind of culture generates the highest per capita cyber-scammers?

Telly was great in The Dirty Dozen (as were all the others), but his nomination was for Birdman of Alcatraz.  I saw that one many years after it first came out so I felt that I never got the full impact.

The core issue left over from WW2 in Asia is simply this: historically aware Chinese uncomfortably know that Japan's surrender was not caused by anything that Chuna did, and they yearn for further vindicstion.  This is compounded by the outcome of China's civil war, which reconfigured intrrnstional relations in Asia snd turned the post WW2 settlement process in an unanticipated direction.

Scott,

You assume I have no idea.

I wrote the way I did because I know the people of Gaza, at the moment, are powerless to effect change. Unseating Hamas from power will take outside intervention and a genuine long-term commitment to see through economic development and nation-building from scratch. I've actually seen the deplorable conditions with my own eyes.

As for the hate you ascribe to me without knowing me, I hold no such emotion. I have the capacity to understand and feel the helplessness Gazans feel. I have the capacity to feel and understand what it's like to be trapped in the middle of a war zone and have nowhere to go. I have the capacity and experience of being in an unprotected building and hearing and seeing ammunition explode around. I've heard the sound of gunfire nearby. I've seen abject poverty and I've seen the effects of tyrannical rule.

I've also experienced life in Israel before the Iron Dome. Have you ever had to get out of a bus because there is a suspicious package in it? Have you ever experienced anxiety because your loved one was at a shopping center that was attacked and you have no idea whether they survived? Do you have any idea what it's like to live knowing that the bus you will be on, the bus stop you will wait at, shop you will be in might explode?

Both sides have valid grievances and both sides need to adjust to the fact that they're both there to stay.

Hate is a useless emotion. It is what gets in the way of progress.

People believe in the official inflation and unemployment rates when they suit  their needs. When they don't they can be picked apart as inaccurate.  Krugman is no different than any other political pundit.

M2 money stock has soared from about $8.4 trillion in July 2009 to $11.4 trillion now. In one year alone, from July 2013 it soared from $10.7 trillion to the present $11.4 trillion. So, there has been a vast growth of the money supply but there has been no rampant inflation. Real wages haven't gone up enough to provide consumers with sufficient spending power to cause inflation; in fact, real wages may have declined from the 2007 level.

I heard a report where the Separatists posted a comment on Facebook that they had the black boxes,  They removed it later but if it's true that makes it that much harder to prove.  Maybe that's why they took them. Do innocent people go to such an extreme?  There is nothing Putin will not do to get them.

Russia is constantly arguing against any new sanctions, so having long range radar systems and air controllers, you consider it would deliberately shut down the air plain?
Separatists does need this ether, they are wining that war, so it is not in their interest.
The Malaysian Boeing has the same color White, Blue and Red stripes exactly as Russian Government air company "Russia" , so it is regular Ukrainian disorganization, they are blaming Russia for violating their air space for last several months since beginning of conflict, so they finally shoot down "Russian" airplane.

Why does the press refer to the fighters as "Separatists"? This does them a great service in characterizing them as something other than what they are, namely Russian Special Ops.
These systems take two years to operate and understand.

I find it very sad that one tragedy may serve as a pretext for an even bigger tragedy. Incitement to war shouldn't mean we're gullible enough to be enticed into one. We're spread too thin to fight a just war, let alone a convoluted one with Russia's Putin, fascist Ukrainian nationalists in parliament (do a profile search; there are a lot of them) and ordinary Ukrainian citizens caught in the middle whom we'd like to help but can't reliably do thanks to all the disinformation and propaganda fouling the water.

"There is nothing that Putin does for which he is willing to accept consequence."

If there are no consequences, there is nothing to accept.

"Vice President Bush defended the downing of the Iranian Airbus [Flight 655] by an American warship, asserting that the real problem in the Persian Gulf was Iran's refusal to stop its war with Iraq in accordance with a Security Council resolution."  --NYT, July 15, 1988

The gall of Putin to deflect blame to Ukraine is only in keeping of his culture of
utterly universal denial, deception and impunity. There is nothing that Putin does for which he is willing to accept consequence. Always the first to claim
dominance, the last to admit the foul nexus of his goals, method and certainly, not counting the corpses in his wake.
American intelligence has a missile hitting the plane by satellite picture.  No mechanical problem here.  Just a question of which side did it.

Mr Larkin,  Exactly what have you been smoking or ingesting?  The evidence is overwhelming that a Russian made missile, issued to the Russian separatists is what brought this plane down.  According the audio tapes of the conversation between the parties involved a cover-up is being instituted by claiming that the plane was full of spies.  Are you related to Neville Chamberlain?

Negligence. The Kazaki unit that shot down the plane used a Russian supplied system transported into Ukraine, and it no doubt mistook the civilian plane for a military one. Putin says Russian involvement is stupid, but there's no question that putting such weapons at the disposal of amateurs results in tragedies like this. Putin will reap the whirlwind he has sewed in Ukraine. His blunders with regard to Ukraine grow every day. If Russians have any brains, they'll leash him.
Who ended the ceasefire last week?

The ceasefire was ended after the Russian mercenaries and terrorists refused to recognize and reciprocate it: they killed 27 Ukrainian service people during the 10 days it was in force. President Putin put no pressure on his mercenaries to actually stop shooting or killing.

Details, details...

In his effort to destabilize Ukraine and keep it from allying with Europe - as most of Ukraine's citizens would like to do - Putin given a ragtag band of bullies a lot of sophisticated ordinance. The outcome is no less tragic by the fact that it is the inevitable consequence of Putin's recklessness.
Experts are commenting that commercial planes fly over areas of conflict all the time.
Hope and change is one policy but not realistic. Trust but verify. Time to verify what is obvious, this is a Russian mission. The answer is to attend a fund raiser for the Democrats.

According to Washington officials and aviation experts being interviewed right now, it was in an approved route that was not part of the no-fly zone announced by the FAA in April. Apparently there were 3-4 other commercial planes in the immediate vicinity.

The no-fly zone has now been significantly expanded.
